DOC.brief_summary: In the past years several shoulder reconstruction systems with different types of prostheses and fixation methods have been developed to improve shoulder arthroplasty, trying to cover a wide range of pathologies and revision situations. The aim of the present study is to report radiological and clinical outcome with a stemless shoulder implant with hollow screw fixation.
DOC.brief_title: Humeral Head Implants: Radiological and Clinical Evaluation
DOC.criteria: Age 40 to 85 years at time of surgery Patients with primary or secondary osteoarthritis of the shoulder Patients with cuff tear arthropathy and axillary nerve lesions
